title: Mount View holds serve at home against neighboring Belfast
text:
Mount View holds serve at home against neighboring Belfast Arthurs, Lord score for hosts, Beaulieu for Lions; goalies superb in net By Ken Waltz | Oct 01, 2015 Photo by: Ken Waltz View More... 
Thorndike — The fact Mount View has experienced solid, consistent success this fall and Belfast was coming off its first win of the season set the perfect stage for what one expected to be a close, tightly-contested high school girls soccer game between the Waldo County athletic rivals on Thursday afternoon, Oct. 1. 
And that is just what the host Mustangs and visiting Lions provided fans — and most of the youth soccer players in the greater Thorndike area on-hand to be recognized at halftime — on a cold, blustery day and a somewhat wet field from the previous day's several inches of rain. 
Mount View scored a second-half goal to break up a 1-1 tie to pull out a 2-1 victory over Belfast as the Mustangs climbed back above .500 for the season in a hard-fought game played under dark, threatening skies. 
Video from the varsity game and a link to photos from the varsity and javyee games will appear later with this story. 
The Mustangs scored first and appeared in control until the Lions knotted the game — and appeared to grab the momentum — in the final 30 seconds of the first half. 
That late goal might have deflated most teams, however, Mount View shook it off and dominated much of the final 40 minutes of play, scoring the decisive goal, but also hitting the post/crossbar several times with strong scoring attempts. 
Cate Arthurs and Ryleigh Lord scored for Mount View, while Meri Picard added an assist. For Belfast, Faith Beaulieu tallied a goal. 
Both goalies — Mustang Jenni Nadeau (2 saves) and Lion Shera Hilt (6 saves) — played superbly in net. In fact, Hilt followed her 80-minute effort in the varsity game with more time defending the goal during the jayvee contest. 
The Mustangs finished with 12 shots on goal and seven corner kicks — all taken by Picard. The Lions had four shots on goal and one corner kick. 
The Mustangs took a 1-0 lead when Arthurs scored, on Picard's assist, with 33:43 left in the opening half. Beaulieu tallied the equalizer with a mere 22 seconds remaining in the same half. 
Lord booted in the game-winner on a direct kick from 20 yards out with 19:29 left in the second half. 
Mount View had the better of play overall, especially in the first 15 minutes of the second half, when the hosts clanged hard shots off the crossbar and post. 
Belfast also had a few offensive thrusts but could not, in the end, put consistent pressure on the Mustang defense or Nadeau. 
Mount View continues to play well and push to host a future prelim playoff game and Thursday's performance helped the 'Stangs take one more step in that direction. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Mount View (5-4) was eighth and Belfast (1-8) 17th. However, that does not include Thursday's outcome. Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston (8-0-1) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
